parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Groups

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a new [[Group]] for the given [[Side]].

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>
* Groups can only be created for the [[west]]/[[blufor]], [[opfor]]/[[east]], [[independent]]/[[resistance]], [[civilian]] and [[sideLogic]] sides.
* The default limit of groups per side is 288 since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v1.67 (144 before and in previous titles).
* Using a wrong side or trying to create a group when the groups limit is reached will fail silently and return [[grpNull]].
* Before <template><title>arma3</title></template> a [[Side]] [[createCenter|center]] must exist before group creation (either by having editor-placed units or [[createCenter]] usage).
</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3 </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>
* When the last unit leaves its group, the group usually gets immediately auto-deleted, regardless of its auto-deletion setting.
* Usage of [[createCenter]] in <template><title>arma3</title></template> is not required anymore as all centers are automatically created.
</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>  [[createGroup]] side

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> side: [[Side]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Group]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[createGroup]] [side, deleteWhenEmpty] <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.67</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value>  [side, deleteWhenEmpty]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> side: [[Side]]

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> deleteWhenEmpty: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to [[deleteGroupWhenEmpty|delete the group when empty]].
* If set to [[true]], ''deleteWhenEmpty'' forces a group to get deleted when empty - it does '''not''' prevent its deletion by other commands when set to [[false]].
* Deletion may take up to a minute after the last unit is removed.

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Group]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _group = [[createGroup]] [[east]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _group = [[createGroup]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[east]], [[true]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[deleteGroup]], [[deleteGroupWhenEmpty]], [[isGroupDeletedWhenEmpty]], [[group]], [[setGroupId]], [[groupID]], [[units]], [[groupFromNetId]], [[netId]], [[leader]], [[selectLeader]], [[join]], [[createCenter]], [[createUnit]], [[createVehicle]], [[Side]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 10, 2007</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:5133p39|5133p39]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In '''<template><title>arma1</title></template>''', empty groups are not automatically deleted - if you created 144 groups, you will not be able to create new group even if all units in all those groups died, because all the 144 groups still exists - you will have to delete some groups manually.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 04, 2011</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
A group created with [[createGroup]] will get a waypoint at [0,0,0]. When you use [[createUnit]] to fill it with units, it will get an additional waypoint at the position the first unit is created. This new waypoint will also be set as [[currentWaypoint]]. However keep these two waypoints in mind when you do some scripting involving this groups' waypoints.
</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>ofpe</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template></root>
